channel.title: Two Posinter on Hashnopolis
channel.description: Recent content in Two Posinter on Hashnopolis

item.title: Meeting Rooms II
item.description: Given an array of meeting time intervals consisting of start and end times [[s1,e1],[s2,e2],...] (si < ei), find the minimum number of conference rooms required. Example 1: Input: [[0, 30],[5, 10],[15, 20]] Output: 2 Example 2: Input: [[7,10],[2,4]] Output: 1 Solution: # Definition for an interval. # class Interval: # def __init__(self, s=0, e=0): # self.start = s # self.end = e # |____| |_______| # |_______| |____| # Number of meeting rooms: 2 class Solution(object): def minMeetingRooms(self, intervals): """ :type intervals: List[Interval] :rtype: int """ starts, ends = [], [] length = len(intervals) for i in range(length): starts.
